channel.title: RSPS Character File
channel.description:
Hey Guys I Need Help Fixing The Character Files Its Not Saving The Account Ive Tried Everything If Someone Can Help Or Tell Me Which File Find The Info About Saving Character On Logout Would Be Great
Its a PI/317 Source (Runique)

item.title: RSPS Character File
item.dc:creator: @WarTusk-RSPS WarTusk-RSPS
item.description:
@WarTusk-RSPS wrote:

I do not sorry about that. but there should be a playersave.java, because that is how you add new point systems like “donator points” and that type of stuff. So the person who released that source most likely completely deleted it. I would try to get a good playersave.java from another source or just go with another source but those are just my suggestions

Read full topic

I am sorry, I meant playersave.java not playersaving. If you could post your playersave.java that would be awesome!

there is no playersave.java you got team viewer ?

item.title: RSPS Character File
item.dc:creator: @Macca187 Macca187
item.description:
@Macca187 wrote:

[quote=“WarTusk-RSPS, post:2, topic:551520”]go into your playersave.java and search " character " or "character file " or something along those lines and it should give you a result to your path.

Ex: mine is

characterfile = new BufferedReader(new FileReaderb[/b]);

So it will try to save the character file in my data folder and it will look for a file named “characters” and it will put the saved character account in there. So make sure you put the file in the right place.

Hope this helps you a little bit more in fixing the problem.

Also if you google " character saving rsps pi " there are a few posts with other fixes and suggestions.[/quote]

ive tried all the tut on google btw this is my

Playersaving.java

[code]package org.niobe.world.content.saving;

import org.niobe.world.Player;

/**
*
*

  • @author relex lawl
    */
    public interface PlayerSaving {

    public static PlayerSaving PLAYER_SAVING = new FlatFilePlayerSaving();

    public void save(Player player, boolean sendQuery);

    public Login load(Player player);

    public String getDirectory();
    }[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: RSPS Character File
item.dc:creator: @WarTusk-RSPS WarTusk-RSPS
item.description:
@WarTusk-RSPS wrote:

go into your playersave.java and search " character " or "character file " or something along those lines and it should give you a result to your path.

Ex: mine is

characterfile = new BufferedReader(new FileReaderb[/b]);

So it will try to save the character file in my data folder and it will look for a file named “characters” and it will put the saved character account in there. So make sure you put the file in the right place.

Hope this helps you a little bit more in fixing the problem.

Also if you google " character saving rsps pi " there are a few posts with other fixes and suggestions.

Read full topic
